gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: NOAA GOES-R Series Advanced Baseline Imager (ABI) Level 1b Radiances

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information
GOES-R Calibration Working Group
GOES-R Calibration Working Group
GOES-R Series Program
GOES-R Series Program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Advanced Baseline Imager (ABI) instrument samples the radiance of the Earth in sixteen spectral bands using several arrays of detectors in the instrument’s focal plane. Single reflective band ABI Level 1b Radiance Products (channels 1 - 6 with approximate center wavelengths 0.47, 0.64, 0.865, 1.378, 1.61, 2.25 microns, respectively) are digital maps of outgoing radiance values at the top of the atmosphere for visible and near-infrared (IR) bands. Single emissive band ABI L1b Radiance Products (channels 7 - 16 with approximate center wavelengths 3.9, 6.185, 6.95, 7.34, 8.5, 9.61, 10.35, 11.2, 12.3, 13.3 microns, respectively) are digital maps of outgoing radiance values at the top of the atmosphere for IR bands. Detector samples are compressed, packetized and down-linked to the ground station as Level 0 data for conversion to calibrated, geo-located pixels (Level 1b Radiance data). The detector samples are decompressed, radiometrically corrected, navigated and resampled onto an invariant output grid, referred to as the ABI fixed grid.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Data provided by the 16 spectral channels are used to generate Level 2 and higher products, and are also used in numerical weather prediction models, aiding meteorologists and others in monitoring and predicting all kinds of weather and other phenomena.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Example of ABI L1b data for each of the 16 bands.

GOES fixed grid projection x-coordinate (projection_x_coordinate)
Scan start and end times in seconds since epoch (2000-01-01 12:00:00)
GOES-R ABI fixed grid projection

GOES-R fixed grid projection y-coordinate north/south extent of image

GOES-R fixed grid projection x-coordinate west/east extent of image
nominal satellite subpoint latitude (platform latitude) (latitude)
nominal satellite subpoint longitude (platform longitude) (longitude)
nominal satellite height above GRS 80 ellipsoid (platform altitude) (height_above_reference_ellipsoid)
geospatial latitude and longitude references
Flag indicating the spacecraft is operating in yaw flip configuration
ABI band number (sensor_band_identifier)
ABI band central wavelength (sensor_band_central_radiation_wavelength)
bandpass-weighted solar irradiance at the mean Earth-Sun distance (toa_shortwave_irradiance_per_unit_wavelength)

Inverse of the incoming top of atmosphere radiance at current earth-sun distance (PI d2 esun-1)-1, where d is the ratio of instantaneous Earth-Sun distance divided by the mean Earth-Sun distance, esun is the bandpass-weighted solar irradiance and PI is a standard constant used to convert ABI L1b radiance to reflectance
wavenumber-dependent coefficient (2 h c2/ nu3) used in the ABI emissive band monochromatic brightness temperature computation, where nu =central wavenumber and h and c are standard constants
wavenumber-dependent coefficient (h c nu/b) used in the ABI emissive band monochromatic brightness temperature computation, where nu = central wavenumber and h, c, and b are standard constants
spectral bandpass correction offset for brightness temperature (B(nu) - bc_1)/bc_2 where B()=planck_function() and nu=wavenumber
spectral bandpass correction scale factor for brightness temperature (B(nu) - bc_1)/bc_2 where B()=planck_function() and nu=wavenumber
number of good and conditionally usable pixels
number of missing pixels
number of saturated pixels
number of undersaturated pixels
minimum radiance value of pixels (toa_outgoing_radiance_per_unit_wavelength)
maximum radiance value of pixels (toa_outgoing_radiance_per_unit_wavelength)
mean radiance value of pixels (toa_outgoing_radiance_per_unit_wavelength)
standard deviation of radiance values of pixels (toa_outgoing_radiance_per_unit_wavelength)
percent data lost due to uncorrectable L0 errors
earth sun distance anomaly in astronomical units
container for filenames of dynamic algorithm input data
container for processing parameter filenames
container for algorithm package filename and product version
J2000 epoch time of star observed in seconds (time)
ABI band central wavelength associated with observed star (sensor_band_central_radiation_wavelength)
ABI star catalog identifier associated with observed star

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Product Definition and Users' Guide (PUG) Vol.1 Main

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Product Definition and User's Guide (PUG) document provides product descriptions and formats for all data and products produced and made available to users by the Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite R Series (GOES-R) Core Ground Segment (GS).

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Product Definition and Users' Guide (PUG) Vol.3 Level 1B Products

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Product Definition and User's Guide (PUG) document provides product descriptions and formats for all data and products produced and made available to users by the Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite R Series (GOES-R) Core Ground Segment (GS).
The fact sheets are designed as quick reference guides to provide users with information on each of the GOES-R series Advanced Baseline Imager's 16 spectral bands.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: These data were produced by the NOAA Office of Satellite and Product Operations (OSPO) and are archived at the NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Raw data downlink is received by the antenna system which processes the data through signal processing equipment to intermediate frequency. Forward error correction is performed. If FEC fails, those packets are dropped. Good packets are input to L0 processing. In L0 processing packets are uncompressed, extracted and byte-aligned (L1a). L1b processing extracts the L1a data, performs radiometric and geometric correction on the data to create L1b data.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The Data Stewardship Maturity Matrix (DSMM) is a unified framework that defines criteria for each of nine components based on measurable practices, which can be used to apply a progressive, 6-level rating to an individual dataset, representing stewardship maturity stages rated as Not Assessed or Not Available (Level 0), adHoc (Level 1), minimum (Level 2), intermediate (Level 3), advanced (Level 4), and optimal (Level 5).

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment was evaluated by the metadata content editor for the NOAA OneStop project using the Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template v4.0.
